page.title: 13SUE RYDER HOME,CHELTENHAM
page.content: The Sue Ryder Home was founded by Lady Ryder of Warsaw.The home is a place where cancer patients are looked after and where there is nursing and medical care and friends and relatives are always welcome.A small section of the home is called Goose Bay and was opened in 1980 with 9 beds.In 1981 the first wing of Leckhampton Court was opened giving 24 beds in all.Each year over 1500 new cancer cases occur in Gloucestershire and each year over 1000 die from this disease.In addition to the Sue Ryder Home,the area Radiotherapy and Oncology Centre,based in Cheltenham,provide a service not only for Glos. but also Herefds.,South Worcs. and the adjacent areas of Gwent and Powys,a population approaching a million people.The Sue Ryder Home is well known locally for the work it does & many people help raise money.
